headline: How Canada's oil sands transformed into one of North America's lowest-cost plays
summary: CALGARY (Reuters) -Giant shovels, driverless trucks and a dog-like robot have all helped Canada's oil sands companies including Imperial Oil and Suncor become some of North America's lowest-cost oil producers, driving down overheads even as the worst inflation in a generation pushed U.S. shale costs up.  As the global oil industry enters a downturn due to economic uncertainty related to U.S. tariffs policy and OPEC+ pumping more barrels, Canada's oil sands industry finds itself in a position of strength.  In the years following the oil price crash of 2014-15, international oil majors including BP, Chevron and Total sold their interests in Canadian oil sands.

headline: Black Sea CPC Blend oil exports seen stable at 1.66 mln bpd in August
summary: Black Sea's CPC Blend oilexports from a terminal in Russia were set at 1.66 millionbarrels per day , or some 6.5 million metric tons, almostunchanged from the July export plan, two sources said...

headline: Factbox-Agreements between US, Indonesian firms in leadup to trade deal
summary: JAKARTA (Reuters) -U.S. President Donald announced a trade agreement with Indonesia that would see Washington lower its tariff rates to 19% from a threatened 32%.  Trump said that the deal includes Indonesia purchasing $15 billion worth of U.S. energy products, without giving specific details.  Last week, Indonesia's wheat flour mills association signed an agreement worth around $1.25 billion with U.S. counterparts to buy at least 1 million metric tons of U.S. wheat per year from 2026 until 2030.
